sections.text: Lunch Working Session Agenda — Tom Sabo (WS-EQA Equity & Access) + John Black
Purpose: Get WS-EQA moving fast toward a reviewable v1 deliverable for Meeting 4 and a crisp 3–5 minute briefing.

Context anchors (SoR): WS-EQA lead/co-lead assignments and responsibilities; WS-EQA deliverable D-EQA-1 Equity Impact Checklist v1 due 6 Mar (Meeting 4) ; Meeting 4 focus is constraints + risk register and requires D-EQA-1 as an input ; shared baseline realities (access inevitable; detection weak; risks real) .

heading_path: 1) Open and align on “what success looks like” (5 min)
sections.text: Objective: Tom leaves lunch with a simple definition of done and a plan he believes he can execute.

heading_path: 1) Open and align on “what success looks like” (5 min)
sections.text: Talking points

heading_path: 1) Open and align on “what success looks like” (5 min)
sections.text: Meeting 4 is a convergence gate: we need usable drafts more than perfect prose .

heading_path: 1) Open and align on “what success looks like” (5 min)
sections.text: WS-EQA output is explicitly: “Equity Impact Checklist v1: accessibility/accommodations + do-no-harm risks + recommended supports + metrics” .

heading_path: 1) Open and align on “what success looks like” (5 min)
sections.text: Reinforce partnership: Tom (lead) + Elizabeth Chua (co-lead) are the intended “1:1 synthesis pair.”

heading_path: 1) Open and align on “what success looks like” (5 min)
sections.text: Decision: Confirm we’re targeting a reviewable v1 (not polished/final).

heading_path: 2) Clarify the exact written product due for Meeting 4 (10 min)
sections.text: Objective: Convert “Equity Impact Checklist v1” into a concrete artifact spec.

sections.text: Inputs it must reflect (even if placeholders):

heading_path: 2) Clarify the exact written product due for Meeting 4 (10 min)
sections.text: Student/staff AI use will happen regardless → plan for disparities, not prevention

heading_path: 2) Clarify the exact written product due for Meeting 4 (10 min)
sections.text: Integrity enforcement won’t be detector-driven → avoid inequitable false accusations

heading_path: 2) Clarify the exact written product due for Meeting 4 (10 min)
sections.text: Meeting 4 produces top risks + mitigations; WS-EQA should propose equity-related risks/mitigations ready to drop into that register

heading_path: 2) Clarify the exact written product due for Meeting 4 (10 min)
sections.text: Dependency note (important): D-EQA-1 depends on Scenario Bank v1 (D-CPX-1) so the checklist can be tested against real classroom scenarios . If CPX is late, Tom should still ship the checklist and add “to validate against scenario set” as an explicit follow-on task.

heading_path: 3) Split work cleanly with the co-lead (Elizabeth Chua) (10 min)
sections.text: Objective: Prevent “lead does everything” failure mode.

sections.text: Proposed division of labor (fast, low-friction)

sections.text: Concrete next step: Schedule one 45-minute working session this week and one 30-minute final-pass session early next week.

heading_path: 4) Walk-through: how to use Replit app + JSON + GitHub + Miro efficiently (15 min)
sections.text: Objective: Tom can self-serve the “source of truth” and use AI productively without creating drift.

heading_path: 4) Walk-through: how to use Replit app + JSON + GitHub + Miro efficiently (15 min)
sections.text: Use it to track status; treat it as the “what’s due and when” page.

sections.text: Key fields to point to: deliverable ID, due date, dependency on D-CPX-1 .

sections.text: C. GitHub repo (canonical written product)

heading_path: 4) Walk-through: how to use Replit app + JSON + GitHub + Miro efficiently (15 min)
sections.text: Keep the checklist in one file with the deliverable ID in the filename (e.g., D-EQA-1_equity_impact_checklist_v1.md).

heading_path: 4) Walk-through: how to use Replit app + JSON + GitHub + Miro efficiently (15 min)
sections.text: Commit early (even as a skeleton), then iterate. This avoids “lost drafts” and makes integration into Policy Skeleton easier.

heading_path: 4) Walk-through: how to use Replit app + JSON + GitHub + Miro efficiently (15 min)
sections.text: D. Miro (working surface + evidence)

heading_path: 4) Walk-through: how to use Replit app + JSON + GitHub + Miro efficiently (15 min)
sections.text: Use Miro to collect: examples, pain points, equity risks, and “what we say instead” language.

heading_path: 4) Walk-through: how to use Replit app + JSON + GitHub + Miro efficiently (15 min)
sections.text: Export a frame as PDF/image when needed; link the exported artifact inside the GitHub doc so evidence stays attached.

heading_path: 5) Prepare Tom’s 3–5 minute Meeting 4 briefing (10 min)
sections.text: Objective: Tom can deliver a tight update that advances decisions.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: Objective: Leave with commitments, dates, and a first draft target.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: One high-leverage “starter prompt” Tom can use with AI (copy/paste)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: “Create a K-12 Equity Impact Checklist for an AI policy and AI tools. It must include: screening questions, deep-dive prompts, mitigations/supports, and metrics/feedback loops. Align to these responsibilities: equity impacts (access gaps, accommodations, language, disability), accessibility standards/supports, and monitoring disparities. Deliverable is D-EQA-1 due Meeting 4 (Mar 6). Output as a 2–4 page Markdown checklist with an ‘Open Questions for Committee’ section and a ‘Top Equity Risks + Mitigations for Risk Register’ section.”

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: (Then attach the JSON export from the Replit app so the model stays grounded.)

sections.text: # D-EQA-1 — Equity Impact Checklist v1 (WS-EQA)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **Workstream:** WS-EQA (Equity & Access)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **Lead / Co-lead:** Tom Sabo / Elizabeth Chua :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **Due:** Meeting 4 (6 Mar 2026) :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **Definition of done:** Accessibility/accommodations considerations + do-no-harm risks + recommended supports + equity metrics/feedback loops :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **How this is used at Meeting 4:** Apply equity lens to constraints + risk register kickoff :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ## 0) How to use this checklist (1 minute)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **When:** Apply to (a) draft policy language, (b) classroom guidance, and (c) AI tool proposals/workflows.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **Output:** Mark items **Green / Yellow / Red**, note mitigations, and capture **risks for the committee risk register**.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **Baseline realities to design for:** Access is inevitable; detection is weak; risks are real. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)

sections.text: ## 2) Rapid Equity Screen (triage)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **Score each as:** ✅ Green (low risk) / ⚠️ Yellow (needs mitigation) / ⛔ Red (high risk)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Equity domain | Screen question | Rating | Notes (who is impacted / how) | Mitigation needed (one line) |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Access | Does this assume consistent home access to devices/internet? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Access | Does it privilege paid tools, premium tiers, or BYO accounts? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Disability / accommodations | Does it work with IEP/504 accommodations and assistive tech? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Language | Does it support multilingual learners without penalizing language development? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Assessment fairness | Could it increase false accusations or uneven enforcement? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Safety / harm | Could it expose students to harmful content or risky interactions? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Privacy / data | Could data practices disproportionately harm vulnerable students? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Teacher workload | Does it shift burden to teachers in ways that reduce equitable supports? |  |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: **If any ⛔ Red:** add to Section 5 (Risk Register Candidates).

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ## 3) Deep-dive prompts (complete only where Yellow/Red)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ### 3A) Access & opportunity gaps

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - What options exist for students with limited home access (time, device, bandwidth)?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - What “minimum viable access” is required to participate fairly?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - What school-provided alternatives or offline equivalents exist?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ### 3B) Students with disabilities / accommodations

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - Which accommodations are relevant (text-to-speech, speech-to-text, extended time, reduced distraction, etc.)?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - Does the policy/guidance/tool preserve or undermine approved supports?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - What training is needed so staff implement consistently?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ### 3C) English learners / language supports

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - Is translation/paraphrase support allowed, conditional, or prohibited by task type?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - Does the approach penalize students for using supports to access grade-level content?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - What guardrails preserve learning goals while supporting access?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ### 3D) Fairness in integrity / enforcement

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - If misuse is suspected, what evidence is expected (process evidence, conferencing, drafts)?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - How do we avoid “detector-only” reliance and uneven discipline?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: - What consistency mechanisms exist (rubrics, escalation path, documentation)?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ## 4) Required mitigations & supports (choose and tailor)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: > Convert each Yellow/Red item into one or more concrete mitigations/supports.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Risk driver | Mitigation / support | Owner (who implements) | Where it lives (policy / guidance / PD / tool governance) |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Access gaps | Provide school-based access windows; device lending; offline alternative |  |  |

sections.text: | Paid tool advantage | District-provided equivalent; ban paywalls for required work |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Accommodations conflict | Explicit accommodation-safe guidance; SPED review step |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | ELL burden | Approved language supports + examples by grade band |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Uneven enforcement | Standard process evidence expectations; educator decision support |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Privacy harms | Data minimization; opt-outs; restricted categories |  |  |

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: | Staff capacity | PD micro-modules; quick-reference cards; exemplars |  |  |

sections.text: ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────0) HOW TO USE (FAST)Apply this checklist to: (a) policy language, (b) classroom guidance, (c) AI tools/workflows.For each item: mark ✅ Green / ⚠️ Yellow / ⛔ Red.If Yellow/Red: write a mitigation and decide where it lives (policy, guidance, PD, tool governance).Add any ⛔ risks to the risk register candidates (Section 5).──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: 1) SCOPE OF REVIEW (FILL IN)What is being reviewed? _________________________________________________Type (circle): Policy section / Guidance / Tool / Workflow / Other: ________Target users: Students / Staff / Families / Other: ______________________Grade bands: Elementary / Middle / High / Other: _______________________Setting(s): In-class / Homework / Assessment / IEP/504 / ELL / Other: __Data touched: Student PII / Student work / Staff data / Vendor data / NoneDecision needed by Meeting 4? Yes / NoIf yes, what decision? _________________________________________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────2) RAPID EQUITY SCREEN (TRIAGE)Rating key: ✅ Green (low risk) ⚠️ Yellow (needs mitigation) ⛔ Red (high risk)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: For each row: Rating + Notes + One-line mitigation.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: A) ACCESS & OPPORTUNITY[ ] Assumes consistent home device/internet access? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________[ ] Privileges paid tools/premium tiers/BYO accounts? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________[ ] Requires advanced digital literacy without supports? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: B) DISABILITY / ACCOMMODATIONS (IEP/504)[ ] Conflicts with accommodations or assistive tech? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________[ ] Adds barriers for sensory/attention/motor needs? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: C) LANGUAGE (ELL / MULTILINGUAL LEARNERS)[ ] Penalizes translation/paraphrase supports? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________[ ] Creates inequity for students developing English? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: D) FAIRNESS IN INTEGRITY / ENFORCEMENT[ ] Could increase false accusations or uneven enforcement? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________[ ] Depends on detectors/probability scores to decide? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: E) SAFETY / WELL-BEING[ ] Exposes students to harmful content or risky contact? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: F) PRIVACY / DATA / RECORDS[ ] Data practices disproportionately harm vulnerable groups? Rating: __ Notes: ________ Mitigation: ______________________[ ] Unclear retention/training use/parental consent? Rating: __ Notes: __________ Mitigation: ______________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: G) STAFF CAPACITY (EQUITY VIA IMPLEMENTATION)[ ] Shifts workload to teachers in ways that reduce support? Rating: __ Notes: _________ Mitigation: ______________________[ ] Requires training/tools that aren’t universally available? Rating: __ Notes: _______ Mitigation: ______________________

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: If any ⛔ Red: add to Section 5 (Risk Register Candidates).

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: 3A) Access & opportunity gaps• What minimum access is required (time, device, bandwidth, accounts)?• What is the equitable alternative (offline option, school-provided access window, district tool)?• What guidance ensures students aren’t penalized for access limitations?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: 3B) Disability & accommodations• Which accommodations apply (TTS/STT, extended time, reduced distraction, etc.)?• Does this preserve or undermine approved supports?• What staff guidance/PD is required for consistent implementation?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: 3C) Language supports• Are translation/paraphrase supports allowed, conditional, or prohibited by task type?• How do we preserve learning goals while supporting access?• What examples will prevent inconsistent enforcement?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: 3D) Integrity & enforcement fairness• What evidence will staff use (process evidence, drafts, conferencing, reflections)?• What is explicitly prohibited (detector-only decisions)?• What is the escalation path for disputes?

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────4) REQUIRED MITIGATIONS & SUPPORTS (CONVERT ⚠️/⛔ INTO ACTION)For each risk driver, state: mitigation + owner + where it lives.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: Risk driver: ______________________Mitigation/support: _______________________________________________________Owner (who implements): _________________________________________________Where it lives (circle): Policy / Guidance / PD / Tool governance / Other: __

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: (Repeat as needed)

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: Quick examples (edit to fit):• Access gaps → school access windows + offline equivalents + device lending• Paid advantage → district-provided equivalent or “no paywall for required work”• Accommodations conflict → SPED review step + accommodation-safe guidance• Uneven enforcement → standard process-evidence expectations + documentation

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────5) EQUITY RISKS FOR MEETING 4 RISK REGISTER (TOP CANDIDATES)Write 3–7 risks in “register-ready” format.

sections.text: (Repeat as needed)

sections.text: Suggested metric starters (pick 3–6):• Access availability (device/connectivity) by grade/school/subgroup• Integrity disputes/referrals by subgroup• Accommodation barriers reported by SPED/504 category• ELL supports usage and outcomes by level/grade• Staff training completion by role/school• Student/family feedback themes by subgroup/school

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────8) 3–5 MINUTE BRIEFING (READABLE SCRIPT)Purpose (1 sentence): WS-EQA produced an Equity Impact Checklist to prevent unintended harm and monitor disparities.

heading_path: 6) Close: lock the plan + immediate action items (5 min)
sections.text: What’s in v1 (3 bullets):• Rapid triage screen (Green/Yellow/Red)• Mitigations/supports (who does what; where it lives)• Metrics + feedback loop
